instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power - no charger light
threads.message:
No <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 0V
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>
1-3.8mV
2-16.44V
3-3.95V
9-33.1mV
12 - 3.42V
13-3.39V
14-3.28V
15-59mV
19 5.5V
20-5.5V
27-16.46V
resistance 17/18=2.9 ohm
resistance 27/28=21.9ohm
I've tried swapping and resoldering the ISL at least twice... at one point there was voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>... it seems if I move a charger from working to this board I get a green light intermittently on charger. All resistors around 7100 measure good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power - no charger light
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground at F7140/41.
If good, change <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power - no charger light
threads.message: Voltage drops on both F7140/1 were .446V. Swap <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR>. Still 0V @ <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. Seem to be getting a green on charger more consistently but again had to connect it to working device first to get green light with this board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power - no charger light
threads.message:
Forget that kind of Magsafe swap between two boards; is normal behavior.

Did you try another DCIN board?
Post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> voltages and check continuity from its pin 5 to central pin of Magsafe.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power - no charger light
threads.message: geez DCin board was no bueno. And my charger sketched out apparently. I had zero on everything haha. So green to orange light on charger wo battery and no fan spin.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power - no charger light
threads.message:
Which is the exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage?
Is the battery charging?
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?
Are you using original 60/85W Magsafe charger?
